heading: 2.1 Near Infrared Spectrosopy
text: Continuous wave NIRS devices use modified Beer-Lambert law calculate volume oxygenated deoxygenated hemoglobin.Spatially resolved NIRS devices use multiple transmitters different distances reciever calculate Tissue Saturation Index, TSI.NIRS device utilized study PortaMon Artinis Medical Systems. PortaMon considered continuous wave spatially resolved device. uses three continuous-wave transmitters single receiver calculate TSI.transmitter emits two wavelengths infrared light. One wavelength oxygenated hemoglobin one wavelength deoxygenated hemoglobin, therefore transmitter measures oxygenated deoxygenated hemoglobin.transmitters emit light tissue light waves bounce structures tissue return receiver.receiver measures light returns Optical Densities. Calculations using several different parameters assumptions convert OD usable units.Subcutaneous adipose tissue different optical properties muscle tissue. calculations account two separate layers tissue different scattering optical properties. papers within last years examining multi-layered tissues effects NIRS measurements using computer modeling phantom tissues. papers utilizing NIRS exercise physiology assume limited negligible effect adipose tissue thickness measurements report participants’ adipose tissue thickness.Different areas body different types tissue structure different optical properties. Previous papers reported measurements optical properties various locations body. Consult device manufacturer reports optical properties determine best settings device.studies assume tissue structures constant optical properties. may hold true, especially activities like exercise blood flow increases contents blood fluctuate. Accounting varying optical properties led development time-domain measurement techniques. devices expensive continuous wave device. Therefore, NIRS devices assume constant optical properties measured tissues.differential pathlength factor (dpf) measurement path light waves take tissue. DPF values well researched measured multiple body locations differing adipose tissue thicknesses. parameter used calculating TSI.

heading: A.1 Specifications
text:
PortaMon Artinis Medical Systems spatial-resolved near-infrared resonance spectroscopy device. uses one receiver three infrared transmitters. transmitter 5 millimeters receiver. allows application mathematical formulas calculate absolute tissue hemoglobin saturation, Artinis Medical Systems refers Tissue Saturation Index, TSI. literature, referred various acronyms, TOI (Tissue Oxygenation Index). full examination mathematics physics behind calculation TSI published part SPIE Conference Optical Tomography Spectroscopy Tissue III 1999.1The yellow case one unit.contains following:ASUS laptoplaptop charging chord European American outlet converter
yellow Artinis Oxysoft USBBluetooth dongleROCKEY4ND license key
PortaMon device
two batteriesbattery charging dockmicro-USB chord battery charging dock

heading: B.3.1 Calibration

heading: C.1 Brief Fatigue Inventory
text: Brief Fatigue Inventory (BFI) 9 item survey designed assess fatigue severity cancer patients.2 item measured 0-10 numeric scale. final score mean 9 measure items can range 0-10. score can calculated least 5 items 9 answered taking mean completed items.

heading: C.2 Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire
text: Godin Shephard made Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire (LTEQ) 1985.3 LTEQ originally two item survey: “Item 1 consists 3 parts, participants note often per week strenuous, moderate, mild exercise. Item 2 asks participants note often engage activity long enough work sweat.“ used group people several different categories activity levels.2011, Godin published Godin-Shephard Leisure Time Physical Activity Questionnaire (GLTPAQ).4 removed second item used group respondents 2 categories, “insufficiently active” “active” based ACSM guidelines weekly moderate strenuous physical activity levels.form use says Godin-Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire across top form, Oncology Nursing Society. bottom left, says ‘adapted : Godin, G. (2011). Godin-Shephard leisure-time physical activity questionnaire. Health & Fitness Journal Canada, 4(1), 18-22.’ don’t know ’s title chose put top form, ’s made things confusing needs . far unable find original paper uses form.

heading: E.1.1 Specifications
text:
lactate threshold test completed cycle ergometer.Ventilatory measurements collected breath breath via metabolic cart.
Lactate measured via finger prick.Prior beginning exercise testing, measure resting blood lactate. less 2.0 mmoL/L order begin testing. Normal resting blood lactate lies 0.8-1.2 mmoL/L, however stress nervousness prior exercise test can increase resting blood lactate levels. lactate levels slightly elevated still lower 2.0 mmol/L, lactate may drop back body uses lactate warm stages.exercise test conducted follows:Begin two minute rest. subject sits stationary bike without pedaling two minutes.
subsequent stage three minutes duration. wattage increases consistent amount stage. last 30 seconds stage, blood lactate measured via finger prick. lactate measurement taken pairs duplicability.Lactate increase exercise difficulty increases. subject’s blood lactate exceeds 4.0 mmol/L, subject finish next stage end test. subject feels complete next stage, end test immediately. blood lactate 4.0 mmol/L roughly correspond moderately difficult exercise intensity maximal effort.

heading: E.1.2 Selecting Wattage Jumps
text: Discuss subject’s physical activity levels. subject doesn’t participate much cardiorespiratory fitness activities, start low wattage (10 Watts) make modest jumps (15 Watts). subject participates long distance running, cycling, swimming, subject may start higher wattage less fit subjects /make larger jumps.selecting wattage jumps, remember lactate increase exponentially wattage increases linearly. Also, conducting testing, second chance get testing correct. better use low starting wattage modest increases initial settings, subject fitter expected blood lactate levels remain stagnant, wattage jumps can increased testing. Blood lactate go time takes conduct testing, difficulty increases quickly blood lactate levels increase quickly difficult analyze lactate curve.

heading: E.2.1 Specifications
text: /kinetics test completed cycle ergometer.Ventilatory measurements collected breath breath via metabolic cart (ParvoMedics OneTrue 2400, B). Muscle oxygenation measurements collected via SR-NIRS (Artinis Medical Systems PortaMon, )exercise test consists three square-wave transitions exercise 110% wattage lactate threshold rest. stage test two minutes long.

heading: F.2.1 Participants
text:
Participants recruited study breast cancer gynecological cancer patients (N=40) agree participate exercise study examining effects chemotherapy muscle mitochondrial oxidative capacity, measure skeletal muscle health. written informed consent obtained participants data collection. study submitted review Institutional Review Board Prisma Office Research Compliance Administration (ORCA). pledge abide applicable institutional governmental regulations regarding ethical use human volunteers duration research.study focuses breast cancer gynecological cancer patients undergo standard care chemotherapy treatment directed oncologist.
eligibility requirements study follows:Patients diagnosed breast cancer gynecological cancer without distance metastasisAges > 20 years oldAble perform exercise stationary cycle ergometer moderate intensities maximum 15 minutesHemoglobin values greater 10 baselineALT AST values less 2.5X upper limit normal institutional standardsGodin-Shepard Leisuretime Physical Activity Questionnaire (GLTEQ) score 14 greater included. score less 14 considered insufficiency active/sedentary.exclusion criteria include patients :Clinically advanced cardiovascular diseaseClinically advanced pulmonary diseaseDisease requiring continuous oxygen supplementationGreater 2 centimeters subcutaneous adipose tissue anterior thighInability walk standMovement disordersSpinal cord injuriesAutoimmune disordersPregnant breastfeedingMini-Mental State Examination (MMSE)Participants study recruited informative pamphlets Center Integrative Oncology Survivorship, Prisma Health System’s Cancer Institute Greenville Memorial Hospital affiliated physician offices.

heading: F.2.2 Experimental Design
text: use observational, 2-way, treatment x time, within-subjects research design compare skeletal muscle oxidative capacity vastus lateralis muscle, stationary cycling, across breast cancer gynecological cancer patients baseline across chemotherapy regimen. Muscle mitochondrial oxidative capacity Vastus Lateralis muscle non-invasively evaluated using continuous wave, Near Infrared Resonance Spectroscopy (NIRS, PortaMon Artinis Medical Systems BV Netherlands).

heading: F.2.3 Study protocol
text:
NIRS participant testing performed University South Carolina School Medicine Greenville’s Human Performance Laboratory located within Cancer Institute Faris Road facility. Testing take approximately 30 minutes per session, maximum 180 minutes participation per patient. independent variables study drug regimen number chemotherapy treatments. dependent variables study change oxygenation deoxygenation status vastus lateralis measured NIRS device, indicative mitochondrial oxidative capacity, bout cycling. Patients asked avoid exercise use certain substances (tobacco, alcohol, caffeine, contraindicated medications) 24 hours prior testing.NIRS device consists three LED transmitters transmit light waves muscle tissue one high sensitivity PIN diode receiver, equipped ambient light protection, assesses light received transmitters. three transmitters emit light two wavelengths. wavelengths correspond absorption wavelengths oxyhemoglobin (O2Hb) deoxyhemoglobin skeletal muscle tissue (approximately 760 nm 850 nm). wavelengths light received three separate transmitter distances (30mm, 35mm, 40mm) 10 Hz. ΔO2Hb Δ tissue saturation index (TSI%) calculated change last 30-s average work interval last 30-s average recovery interval. Oxygen uptake (VO2) obtained using open-circuit spirometry (Parvo Medics, Inc, Salt Lake City, Utah). Cycling power determined via lactate threshold curves generated participant.
Participants asked perform exercise shorts equivalent. Participants first sit rest chair, NIRS device applied vastus lateralis. device double sided adhesive tape lightly secure position skin. device wrapped black cloth fully secure position, limit device mobility, block ambient light laboratory. Participants stand walk cycle NIRS secured participant’s leg. Participants sit bike 2-minute rest wearing fitted mask comfortably measures participant’s rate amount oxygen uptake (VO2) ventilatory measurements rest exercise.

heading: F.2.3.1 Visit 1
text: Researchers determine participant’s lactate threshold curve ventilatory threshold graded exercise test (Table 1). lactate threshold measure rate capillary blood lactate measurements rise effect increased exercise intensity. blood lactate curve used determine individualized power wattage subsequent exercise testing “-kinetics” (see description). Capillary blood lactate levels obtained finger stick point care testing. Ventilatory threshold measured using indirect calorimetry via metabolic cart captures expired gasses (O2 CO2) comfortable silicone mask worn participant.baseline blood lactate level obtained rest, participant instructed cycle three minutes beginning 10W. 3-minute stage complete, power output increase 15 watts. participant cycle 3 minutes stage lactate threshold reaches 4.0 mmol/L. blood lactate reaches 4.0 mmol/L, one final, three-minute stage performed. final lactate reading obtained completion exercise stage. power output equivalent 1.1x wattage lactate threshold exceeded 4.0 mmol/L used exercise intensity (“-kinetics”) subsequent visits accompanying chemotherapy treatments.

heading: F.2.3.2 Subsequent Visits
text: Participants return subsequent visit within week next chemotherapy infusion long able safely continue exercise protocol (Table 2). NIRS device secured participant’s leg similar first visit participants put mask measure ventilation. Participants begin pedaling warmup 0 watts 2 minutes. two-minute warm period completed, power output increase previously calculated wattage 1.1x LT. participant cycle self-selected cadence power wattage duration 2 minutes (“-kinetics”). end -kinetics stage, participants asked rate level effort exercise, Rate Perceived Exertion (RPE). participant stop pedaling remain recovery, sitting bike 2 minutes (“-kinetics” stage). 5 seconds remaining “-kinetics” stage, participant start pedaling self-selected cadence next “-kinetics” stage, followed another 2-min “-kinetics” period. cycle exercise followed rest, known -kinetics, repeat total maximum 3 times, participant reaches volitional fatigue.

heading: F.2.3.3 Collection of Surveys and Biometrics at Each Visit
text: administering MoCA, BFI, Physical Activity Intake, PROMIS Global Health, GLTPAQ surveys prior participant engagement cycling exercises. also administering BFI, PROMIS Global Health, Physical Activity Follow-surveys individual study session assess changes cancer related fatigue associated chemotherapy treatment may develop throughout study time period.Patients undergo routine, standard care blood draws CBC metabolic testing per managing physician additional tube, venipuncture, study covered aliquot biomarkers related mitochondrial health correlative research.biomarker analysis, exosomes patient serum (approximately 250 uL samples) isolated using ExoQuick ULTRA EV Isolation System (System Biosciences). Exosomes detected Western blotting exosome specific antibodies. Exosome samples sent RNASeq analysis RNA within isolated exosomes System Biosciences. Bioinformatics analysis RNAs identified RNASeq used determine specific RNAs present patient blood associated changes mitochondrial function. addition, selected mRNAs associated mitochondrial function assessed (expression levels determined) RT-qPCR using aliquots isolated serum exosomes.

heading: F.2.4 Statistical Analyses
text: ANOVA one way tukey post-hoc analysis detect differences drug regimen groups time point (baseline, subsequent chemotherapy treatments) time constant response change mitochondrial function mitochondrial oxidative capacity. One-way ANOVAs used additionally detect differences different timepoints baseline final chemotherapy treatment individual chemotherapy regimen.
